intro: Dinochloa kostermansiana, commonly known as the Koster's sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Dinochloa kostermansiana is native to parts of Africa and is often found in humid tropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological systems it inhabits.
